alert.note: Alert for New Kent (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 3:56PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Charles City, Prince George, northwestern York, south central New Kent, Sussex, southeastern Dinwiddie, southwestern James City, and Surry Counties and the City of Williamsburg through 445 PM EDT... At 356 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ruthville to Disputanta to near Carson. Movement was east southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Rainfall of 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Charles City, Holdcroft and Ruthville around 400 PM EDT. Rustic around 405 PM EDT. Claremont and Burrowsville around 410 PM EDT. Sussex and Cabin Point around 415 PM EDT. Waverly around 420 PM EDT. Homeville around 425 PM EDT. Williamsburg, College Of William And Mary, Jamestown and Scotland around 430 PM EDT. Wakefield, Queens Lake, Dendron and Kings Point around 435 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Taylors Corner, Carsley, Chickahominy Shore, Booker, Camp Peary, Yale, Spring Grove, Lumberton, Wharfs Store and Ewell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
